臉書首次進軍數碼醫療領域 推出預防疾病工具

03 Nov 2019, 07:14

【新唐人北京時間2019年11月03日訊】據報導，在劍橋分析醜聞導致臉書（Facebook）進軍醫療市場中斷一年多後，這家社交媒體巨頭正在推出一種名為「預防疾病」（Preventive Health）的工具，以促使用戶定期體檢，並將其連接到醫療服務提供者。
臉書正在與美國癌症協會、美國心臟病學院、美國心臟協會、疾病控制與預防中心合作，開發一系列數位提示，以鼓勵用戶做系列體檢，這對確保特定年齡組人群的健康非常重要。
這項新業務的架構師是該公司醫療保健研究負責人Freddy Abnousi博士，根據CNBC報導，他以前曾蒐集匿名醫院數據，並使用一種稱為「哈希算法」（hashing）的技術將醫療數據與個人相匹配，用於研究。
臉書最初關注的是美國的兩大主要死因：心臟病和癌症，以及每年感染數百萬美國人的流感。該工具允許用戶標記測試完成的時間，設置提醒以安排未來的測試，並向親友宣傳該工具。人們也可以使用這一新健康工具，找到打流感疫苗的地方。
想要訪問臉書預防性健康工具的使用者，可以在公司的移動應用程式中搜索，以查找公司合作夥伴組織根據用戶年齡和性別所推薦的一些體檢。
臉書甚至會引導用戶去哪裡做測試，並保證不會蒐集任何測試結果。「健康是特別個人化的，所以我們從一開始就考慮到了隱私問題。」公司說。不過，鑒於臉書諸多販售個資的前科，用戶並不一定會完全相信臉書的隱私承諾。
──轉自《大紀元》

Facebook enters the digital medical field for the first time

03 Nov 2019, 07:14

[New Tang Dynasty, Beijing time, November 03, 2019] It is reported that after the Cambridge analysis scandal caused Facebook to enter the medical market for more than a year, the social media giant is launching a campaign called Preventive Disease (Preventive). Health) tools to motivate users to have regular medical check-ups and connect them to health care providers.
Facebook is working with the American Cancer Society, the American College of Cardiology, the American Heart Association, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to develop a series of digital tips to encourage users to do a series of physical exams, which is important to ensure the health of a specific age group.
The architect of the new business is Dr. Freddy Abnousi, head of the company's healthcare research. According to CNBC, he has previously collected anonymous hospital data and used a technique called hashing to map medical data with Personal matches are used for research.
Facebook initially focused on two major causes of death in the United States: heart disease and cancer, and the flu that infects millions of Americans every year. The tool allows users to mark when the test is complete, set reminders to schedule future tests, and advertise the tool to relatives and friends. People can also use this new health tool to find a place to get a flu shot.
Users who want to access Facebook preventive health tools can search the company's mobile app to find some of the medical tests recommended by the company's partner organization based on their age and gender.
Facebook will even guide the user where to test and ensure that no test results are collected. "Health is particularly personal, so we considered privacy issues from the start," the company said. However, in view of the many frontiers of Facebook's sale of personal capital, users may not fully believe in Facebook's privacy commitment.
